get.title: 24hr Trading Volume
get.summary: Request information regarding the trading volume for the last 24 hours. The request returns the overall trading volume details in USD as well as the trading volume per token in USD and the native token.

default.description: Returns the trading volume of the last 24 hours.

TotalUSDValue.description: The total trade volume in terms of USD.

tokenAmount.description: The trading volume for a particular token.

USDValue.description: The corresponding trading volume in USD for a particular token.

startDate.description: The start date and time for the volume presented.

get.title: Historic Trading Volume
get.summary: Request information regarding the trading volume for a specific date. The request returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per token.

parameters.name: Year
parameters.description: The year of the specific trading volume request date - in this case 2020.

parameters.name: Month
parameters.description: The month of the specific trading volume request date - in this case 01 (January).

parameters.name: Day
parameters.description: The day of the specific trading volume request date - in this case 01 (1st of a month).

default.description: Returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per trading pair.

TotalUSDValue.description: The total trade volume in terms of USD.

tokenAmount.description: The trading volume for a particular token.

USDValue.description: The corresponding trading volume in USD for a particular token.

startDate.description: The start date and time for the volume presented.

endDate.description: The end date and time for the volume presented.

get.title: Volume ranking by token
get.summary: This returns a user ranking by trading volume for a chosen token. If the parameters startDate and endDate are provided, the ranking includes only trading volume within that window of time. All volumes are quoted in ETH.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency relating to the requested trading volume information.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which the trade volumes are requested. If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which the trade volumes are requested. If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.

default.description: Returns a ranked output of all the trading volumes for a given crypto currency. All the Volumes are quoted in ETH.

amount.description: The trading volume for the address

get.title: User ranking by volume
get.summary: This returns a user ranking by overall trading volume quoted in USD. If the parameters startDate and endDate are provided, the ranking includes only trading volume within that window of time.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which the trade volumes are requested. If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which events are requested.If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.

default.description: Ranked output of all trading volumes for all the tokens.

USDValue.description: The trading volume for the address quoted in USD.

get.title: User 30-day volume
get.summary: Request information regarding the trading volume of a specific address for the last 30 days. The request returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per token. Results are cached for 60 minutes.

parameters.name: Address
parameters.description: This is the specific address for which the  30 day trading volume is requested for.

default.description: Returns the trading volume of the last 30 days for a specific address. The request returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per trading pair. Results are cached for 60 minutes.

TotalUSDValue.description: The total trade volume in terms of USD.

tokenAmount.description: The trading volume for a particular token.

USDValue.description: The corresponding trading volume in USD for a particular token.

startDate.description: The start date and time for the volume presented.

endDate.description: The end date and time for the volume presented.

post.title: Get Config
post.summary: Returns the DeversiFi application configuration details.

signature.description: The signed hash (signature) received during the pre-registration process.

default.description: Returns the DeversiFi application configuration details.

DVF.description: This contains application configuration details per currency that the user has deposited for trade.

depositExpiry.description: Expiry period for deposit. The unit is in hours.

deversifiAddress.description: The address of the DeversiFi exchange.

exchangeSymbols.description: Currency pairs available at the DeversiFi exchange for trade.

tokenRegsitry.description: Detailed information related to each available token.

currency_symbol.description: The currency symbol along with details such as decimals, minOrderSize, startTokenId, settleSpread and tokenAddress.

post.title: Get User Config
post.summary: Returns the DeversiFi application and user configuration details.

signature.description: The signed hash (signature) received during the pre-registration process.

default.description: Returns the DeversiFi application as well as the user configuration details.

DVF.description: This contains application configuration details per currency that the user has deposited for trade.

depositExpiry.description: Expiry period for deposit. The unit is in hours.

deversifiAddress.description: The address of the DeversiFi exchange.

exchangeSymbols.description: Currency pairs available at the DeversiFi exchange for trade.

tokenRegsitry.description: Detailed information related to each available token.

currency_symbol.description: The currency symbol along with details such as decimals, minOrderSize, startTokenId, settleSpread and tokenAddress.

spareStarkVaultId.description: Vault ID of the spare Stark key.

post.title: Pre-register
post.summary: This method is used to bind a Stark public key to a corresponding Ethereum public address. A signed hash is received as an acknowledgement of the binding. The signed hash is required for the registration process.

ethAddress.description: The Ethereum public address required for the pre-registration.

default.description: Returns a signed hash that confirms the binding.

deFiSignature.description: This signature hash is required in order to complete the registration process. This signature states that DeversiFi is aware of the binding between a Stark key and ethereum address.

post.title: Register
post.summary: This method is used to register a Stark key that corresponds to an Ethereum public address, and retrieve DeversiFi application as well as user configuration details. It is important to perform “Pre-registration” before this step.

signature.description: The signed hash (signature) received during the pre-registration process.

default.description: Returns the DeversiFi application as well as the user configuration details.

DVF.description: This contains application configuration details per currency that the user has deposited for trade.

depositExpiry.description: Expiry period for deposit. The unit is in hours.

deversifiAddress.description: The address of the DeversiFi exchange.

exchangeSymbols.description: Currency pairs available at the DeversiFi exchange for trade.

tokenRegsitry.description: Detailed information related to each available token.

currency_symbol.description: The currency symbol along with details such as decimals, minOrderSize, startTokenId, settleSpread and tokenAddress.

spareStarkVaultId.description: Vault ID of the spare Stark key.

post.title: Deposit
post.summary: Submit a notification of a new deposit made.

token.description: The token for which the deposit was made.

starkKey.description: The Stark public key. Both the "x" and "y" part are required.

x.description: The "x" part of the Stark public key.

y.description: The "y" part of the Stark public key.

starkSignature.description: Stark signature consisting of consisting of "r", "s" and the recovery parameter.

r.description: The "r" part of the Stark signature.

s.description: The "s" part of the Stark signature.

recoveryParam.description: The recovery parameter of the Stark signature.

default.description: Returns the deposit notifcation.

isPostedOffchain.description: Flag to indicate if the deposit was posted off chain.

isConfirmedOnChain.description: Flag to indicate if the deposit was confirmed on chain.

_id.description: The internal DeversiFi ID for the deposit

starkSignature.description: Stark signature consisting of consisting of "r", "s" and the recovery parameter.

r.description: The "r" part of the Stark signature.

s.description: The "s" part of the Stark signature.

recoveryParam.description: The recovery parameter of the Stark signature.

ethAddress.description: Ethereum public address of the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the deposit.

post.title: Submit Order
post.summary: This authenticated endpoint is used to submit an order.

cid.description: An optional client id to allow you to track your own orders with a different set of IDs than the ones used by DeversiFi.

gid.description: Optional group ID for the order to help track from client side.

type.description: The type of order. Currently only “EXCHANGE_LIMIT” is accepted.

amount.description: The token amount to be traded.

vaultIdSell.description: The vault ID of the seller.

vaultIdBuy.description: The vault ID of the buyer.

amountSell.description: The total amount to be sold.

amountBuy.description: The total amount to be bought.

tokenSell.description: The Stark token ID for the token being sold.

tokenBuy.description: The Stark token ID for the token being bought.

protocol.description: The protocol used. Currently only "stark" is accepted.

partnerId.description: The ID of the partner. An ID can be requested from the DeversiFi team

feeRate.description: The worst case fee rate that the order was signed with. Part of this will get rebated at settlement

default.description: Returns the order ID of the submitted order.

post.title: Cancel Order
post.summary: This endpoint allows to cancel a specific order.

signature.description: The signed hash (signature) received during the pre-registration process.

default.description: Returns the order ID of the cancelled order.

post.title: Balances
post.summary: This is used to retrieve the total and active balances of a user per token. Active balance is the balance that is currently available. Total balance (specified as balance) is the sum of all the balances including those locked for trading.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

token.description: The token which the balance is specifically requested for.

default.description: Returns the total and active balances of a user per token.

balance.description: It is the total balance available for the user corresponding to the specified token.

activeBalance.description: It is the active balance available for the user corresponding to the specified token.

ethAddress.description: The ethereum public address of the user.

token.description: The token for which the balances are provided.

post.title: Get New Vault Id
post.summary: An authenticated endpoint used to retrieve a vaultId for given token.

default.description: Successful

get.title: Get User Fee Rate
get.summary: Return current fee rate for a given address

default.description: Successful

get.title: Estimated Next Batch Time
get.summary: Returns a countdown until the expected next batch time, which will include all pending withdrawals.

default.description: Successful

post.title: Deposit History
post.summary: This is an authenticated endpoint used to retrieve deposits. A token can be specified to get deposits for a specific token.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

token.description: The token which the balance is specifically requested for.

default.description: Returns the list of deposits. A token can be specified to get deposits for a specific token.

ethAddress.description: Ethereum public address of the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the deposit.

isPostedOffchain.description: Flag to indicate if the deposit was posted off chain.

isConfirmedOnChain.description: Flag to indicate if the deposit was confirmed on chain.

post.title: Order
post.summary: This is endpoint is used to retrieve the details for a specific order using the order ID.

orderId.description: The ID of the order. In case you want to view all open orders, check POST openOrders.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

default.description: Returns details relating to a particular order.

id.description: A secondary ID for the order if passed onto a 3rd party exchange.

type.description: Type of the order. Currently, "EXCHANGE LIMIT" and "EXCHANGE MARKET" are the only types that are supported.

pair.description: The trading pair that was used for this order.

created_at.description: The date and time when the order was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the order was last updated.

user_id.description: ID of the user who placed the order.

post.title: All Orders
post.summary: This endpoints allows to retrieve details on all open orders.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

default.description: Returns all open orders.

type.description: Type of the order. Currently, "EXCHANGE LIMIT" is the only type that is supported.

pair.description: The trading pair that was used for this order.

created_at.description: The date and time when the order was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the order was updated.

user_id.description: ID of the user who placed the order.

post.title: Order History
post.summary: This method is used to retrieve a list of all past orders for a user. This includes executed trades, as well as expired and cancelled orders.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

default.description: Returns a list of all a user's past orders.

type.description: Type of the order. Currently, "EXCHANGE LIMIT" is the only type that is supported.

pair.description: The trading pair that was used for this order.

created_at.description: The date and time when the order was created.

updated_at.description: The date and time when the order was updated.

user_id.description: ID of the user who placed the order.

routing.description: The exchange through which the order was routed, e.g., Bitfinex (BFX).

avg_price.description: The average price that the order was executed at.

active.description: The current status of the order. 1 signifies that the order is still active and can be filled. 0 means that it has been fully executed or canceled.

tif.description: The time in force for the order, signifying the unix timestamp when it will expire and be removed from the order-book.

auth.description: The ethereum address of the owner of the order

post.title: Withdrawal
post.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve details relating to a particular withdrawal.

withdrawalId.description: Used to identify a specific withdrawal.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

default.description: Returns details relating to a particular withdrawal.

_id.description: The internal DeversiFi ID for the withdrawal

ethAddress.description: Ethereum public address of the user.

starkKey.description: The Stark public key of the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the withdrawal.

post.title: Pending Withdrawals
post.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve all pending withdrawals. If a token is specified, withdrawals pertaining to only that particular token are provided.

token.description: This is used to specify a particular token.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

default.description: Returns all the withdrawals.

ethAddress.description: Ethereum public address of the user.

starkKey.description: The Stark public key of the user.

post.title: Withdrawal History
post.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve all historic withdrawals. If a token is specified, withdrawals pertaining to only that particular token are provided.

token.description: This is used to specify a particular token.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

default.description: Returns all the withdrawals.

ethAddress.description: Ethereum public address of the user.

starkKey.description: The Stark public key of the user.

get.title: Orderbook
get.summary: This public endpoint allows to keep track of the state of DeversiFi orderbooks on a price aggregated basis with customizable precision. Raw books can be retrieved by using precision R0.

parameters.name: Precision
parameters.description: Set the price aggregation level. Adjust the precision by entering a value between P0-P4. Raw books can be retrieved by using precision R0. Use one of the following values - P0, P1, P2, P3, P4, R0.

default.description: Returns a specific order and allows you to keep track of the state of Deversifi order books on a price aggregated basis with customizable precision.

Price.description: Specifies the price level for trading.

Count.description: Number of orders at that price level.

Amount.description: Total amount available at that price level.

get.title: Tickers
get.summary: The ticker endpoint provides a high level overview of the state of the market for a specified pair. It shows the current best bid and ask, the last traded price, as well as information on the daily volume and price movement over the last day.

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Specify the trading pair. A list of symbols can also be provided. In order to retrieve the results of all trading pairs, the symbol “ALL” should be used. symbols = ["tMKRETH", "fUSD", "tETHUSD"]

default.description: Returns the current best bid and ask, the last traded price, as well as information on the daily volume and price movement over the last day.

symbol.description: The symbol of the requested trading pair.

bid.description: Price of the most recent highest bid.

bid_size.description: Sum of the 25 highest bid sizes.

ask.description: Price of the most recent lowest ask price.

ask_size.description: Sum of the 25 lowest ask sizes.

daily_change.description: Amount that the last price has changed since yesterday.

daily_change_relative.description: Relative price change since yesterday (x 100 for percentage change).

get.title: Candles
get.summary: The Candles endpoint provides OCHL (Open, Close, High, Low) and volume data for the specified funding currency or trading pair. The endpoint returns the last 100 candles by default, but a limit and a start and/or end timestamp can be specified.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: Specify time frame. Available values are '1m', '5m', '15m', '30m', '1h', '3h', '6h','12h', '1D','7D', '14D', '1M'.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Specify the trading pair for which information is required.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Section for more precise selection. Available values - "last" or "hist"

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Filter start (time since epoch in ms).

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Filter end (time since epoch in ms).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Determines if the results should be sorted. If = 1, it sorts results returned with old > new.

default.description: Returns the last 100 candles by default, but a limit and a start and/or end timestamp can be specified.

open.description: First execution during the time frame.

close.description: Last execution during the time frame.

high.description: Highest execution during the time frame.

low.description: Lowest execution during the time frame.

volume.description: Quantity of symbol traded within the time frame.
